text.0: No, #Rwanda’s president #Kagame hasn’t appointed a 19-year-old teenager as the country’s new minister of technology. No such position exists & the image of the alleged minister shows a 12 year-old British boy said to have an IQ higher than Stephen Hawking. https://t.co/yBWfG8fupi
text.1: @tunajibu But there is no tourism satellite account for Kenya, regarded as the international standard for measuring tourism’s economic value, making accurate estimates difficult. https://t.co/8LAV0uzy9F
text.2:
@tunajibu The minister also claimed that #Kenya’s tourism sector employs about 1.6 million people. 

Available data does point to *approximately* 1.6 million. https://t.co/8LAV0uhWL5
text.4:
:airplane_selector: #Kenya’s #tourism minister Najib Balala (@tunajibu) is calling for more investment in the vital industry following Covid-19 restrictions. 

But was his valuation of this vital sector accurate? We checked. https://t.co/8LAV0uzy9F
text.5: An estimated 4% of women in sub-Saharan Africa suffered from depression in 2017. #InfoFinder
text.6: It is false that there are less than 1000 doctors working in Zimbabwe’s public hospitals. As of February 2020, there were 1,414 doctors and 15,353 nurses working in Zimbabwe’s public hospitals.
text.7: In November 2019, there were 250 registered psychiatrists in #Nigeria.
